page.title: 01POPULATION LONG PRESTON
page.content: Long Preston has 458 people on the Register of Electors. There are 35 children attending the local Primary School. The village is on the A65 between Skipton and Settle.The river Ribble meanders through a flood plain to the west and the farmland is used intensively for cattle and sheep. There is an Anglican Church and Methodist Chapel.The Mechanics Institute is used by a playgroup,Old People's Fellowship,Youth Club and Snooker Club.The school is used in the evenings for Badminton,W.I.,and a Camera Club. The Boar's Head and the Maypole are used by locals but they also hold weekend disco's,cater for functions, and provide bar snacks and meals.
